summary: Email chain between FBI personnel discussing the processing status of digital evidence in the Epstein case, including items from New York City and the US Virgin Islands. The correspondence details completed and outstanding forensic analysis tasks and addresses inventory discrepancies.

persons.name: Steve
persons.role: FBI Senior Forensic Examiner, NY CART Coordinator
persons.context: Appears to be the NY CART Coordinator and Senior Forensic Examiner who compiled and sent the spreadsheet detailing the status of digital evidence processing for the Epstein case.

events.title: Evidence Status Email Exchange
events.description: Email exchange regarding the processing status of digital evidence in the Epstein case, including clarification on inventory items and timelines.

events.title: Forwarded Evidence Status Update
events.description: Email forwarding the previous day's evidence status update, noting that documents from 63 processed items are ready for delivery to SDNY for import into Relativity.

keyFacts: There were 72 total CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team) items: 32 from NYC and 40 from USVI.
63 items had been processed, with documents exported and ready for delivery to SDNY for import into Relativity.
9 items remained outstanding, including an SSD from a DVR, two Macs from USVI needing blacklight analysis, and several RAID arrays needing rebuilding.
Inventory discrepancies were noted, including duplicate hard drives and non-evidentiary items like voice recorders and software CDs.
The correspondence highlights ongoing forensic evidence processing in the Epstein investigation as of July 2020.
